page.title: 04PROTEST IN NETTLETON
page.content: Through the Parish Council Nettleton villagers have expressed great concern about the proposed new tip(C.F.page 3).They have had the advice of a reader in mining and engineering at Nottingham Univ. Residents feel there would be pollution problems from run off water into Nettleton Beck,that there is a danger of Landslip and collapse of the site,not enough account has been taken of the problems caused by the mine shafts near the site and that there would be insufficient control of the types of waste to be tipped.It is also felt that the tip would be an eyesore in an area of outstanding natural beauty, especially as it is next to the Viking Way footpath.Representations have been made to the C.C. which will make its decision on 29th.July 1985.
